body_html:
As pointed out in https://discuss.pytorch.org/t/pytorch-build-compile-problem-cannot-find-lonnxifi-loader/20521/2, it is dangerous to just git pull without git submodule update (since new submodules could be added).

Maybe a foolproof check to build files that check that submodules have been checked out can be added, like that some main files in submodules exist or with git submodule status
body_text:
As pointed out in https://discuss.pytorch.org/t/pytorch-build-compile-problem-cannot-find-lonnxifi-loader/20521/2, it is dangerous to just git pull without git submodule update (since new submodules could be added).
Maybe a foolproof check to build files that check that submodules have been checked out can be added, like that some main files in submodules exist or with git submodule status
body:
As pointed out in https://discuss.pytorch.org/t/pytorch-build-compile-problem-cannot-find-lonnxifi-loader/20521/2, it is dangerous to just `git pull` without `git submodule update` (since new submodules could be added).

Maybe a foolproof check to build files that check that submodules have been checked out can be added, like that some main files in submodules exist or with `git submodule status`
